skill.name: building-agent-tools
skill.description: Guide for creating effective tools for AI agents. Use when building MCP tools, agent APIs, or any tool interface that agents will consume. Focuses on token efficiency, meaningful context, and proper namespacing.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective tools for AI agents. Use when building MCP tools, agent APIs, or any to...
skill.author: Byunk

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for designing AI agent tools. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. This is instructional content only.

content.value_statement: Poorly designed tools waste tokens and confuse AI agents. This guide provides proven patterns for building tools that agents can actually use effectively, from interface design to token optimization.
actual_capabilities: Guides tool interface design with clear naming and parameter definitions
Teaches token efficiency patterns like pagination and filtering
Explains proper namespacing for related tool families
Provides anti-patterns to avoid when building agent tools
Shows how to return semantic identifiers instead of raw IDs
limitations: Does not generate code or tool implementations
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not execute or test user tools
Does not provide tool scaffolding or templates

use_cases.title: Design Tool Architecture
use_cases.description: Plan tool families with proper namespacing and consolidation strategies for your agent platform

use_cases.title: Implement MCP Tools
use_cases.description: Build MCP-compliant tools with proper schema definitions, input validation, and structured responses

use_cases.title: Optimize Agent APIs
use_cases.description: Refactor existing APIs to reduce token usage and improve agent success rates

prompt_templates.title: Basic Tool Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the building-agent-tools skill to help me design a tool for [use case]. What should I consider for naming, parameters, and response format?

prompt_templates.title: Review Tool Schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my tool schema for [tool name] using the building-agent-tools patterns. Are my descriptions clear enough for agents? What improvements would help?

prompt_templates.title: Consolidate Tools
prompt_templates.prompt: I have multiple CRUD tools like [list tools]. Use building-agent-tools to show how I should consolidate them into fewer, more effective tools.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize Token Usage
prompt_templates.prompt: My tool returns too much data and wastes tokens. Apply building-agent-tools patterns to suggest pagination, filtering, and response format improvements.

output_examples.input: Help me design a tool for searching and creating calendar events

âœ“ Include pagination: limit=20, offset=0 with sensible defaults

best_practices: Invest heavily in clear tool descriptions that explain purpose, usage, and return values
Combine related operations into consolidated tools to reduce agent call chains
Use response_format parameters to give agents control over token usage
anti_patterns: Creating many granular CRUD tools that require multiple calls for common workflows
Returning raw IDs or cryptic UUIDs that agents cannot interpret
Omitting pagination on tools that could return large result sets

faq.question: Which AI tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Claude Code. The patterns apply broadly to any agent framework that uses tool calling.

faq.question: What are the token limits for agent tools?
faq.answer: Token limits depend on your model context window. Design tools to return only necessary data and use pagination.

faq.question: How do I integrate these patterns with my existing MCP server?
faq.answer: Apply the tool registration patterns to your MCP tool schema. Review namespacing and descriptions first.

faq.question: Is any data stored or transmitted by this skill?
faq.answer: No. This skill is purely instructional documentation. It does not access files, networks, or external services.

faq.question: Why do my agents make multiple tool calls for simple tasks?
faq.answer: Often caused by granular tools. Consolidate related operations so agents can accomplish goals in fewer calls.

faq.question: How is this different from general API design guides?
faq.answer: Agent tools require different patterns. Focus is on agent comprehension, token efficiency, and autonomous workflow support.
